title: Autistic Cambodian girl, four, drowns in a pond at Texas Buddhist temple
text:
A four-year-old autistic Cambodian girl has drowned after falling into a pond at a Buddhist temple in Texas after slipping out of a ceremony in the temple unnoticed to enter the water.

The child, who has not been named, had gone to the Wat Angkorchum Cambodian Buddhist Temple in Houston, Texas, with her mother on Sunday.

As her mother and other worshipers were inside, the girl wandered out of the temple and down the steps to make her way towards the pond. She took off her shoes and socks before entering the water.

By the time her mother and the others realized she was gone, she was already in the water and completely submerged.

This is the man-made pond the girl drowned in on Sunday after wandering out of the temple. She took off her socks and shoes then got in the water and was found around 15 minutes later, unresponsive

They waded into the water and searched for her for several minutes before pulling her body out.

They pulled her out and, on the way to the hospital, the child regained her pulse but she was pronounced dead later.

There were confused reports initially that the girl was part of a 'class' and that she'd fallen into a man-made well.

Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez said the girl had autism. He also said it is common for children with autism to be drawn to water.

The child's family has not been identified.

According to The Houston Chronicle, she and her family moved to Texas last year from California.

She had been in the water for 15 minutes before she was found.

The congregation was a mix of worshipers from Cambodia, Laos and Thailand.

'Everyone was crying,' one told The Chronicle.
description: The child, who has not been named, had gone to the Wat Angkorchum Cambodian Buddhist Temple in Houston, Texas, with her mother on Sunday.
